intro: Bremeria scabridior, commonly known as the roughleaf bremeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive, coarse texture that aids in its identification. It is a relatively small plant, usually growing to a height of less than 30 centimeters.
